rComments: This is the best class I have ever taken in college. I love professor kenez. His stories and lectures inspires a lot of people. I learned so much about the holocaust I have never learned before. The assign readings are extremely interesting. Take this class; you will not regret it.

Professor Kenez is so sweet. I took his course on the Holocaust taught with Professor Baumgarten. They are both really honest and I appreciate how they explain the Holocaust as something that can be interpreted multiple ways. They make fun of each other which makes their class entertaining.
Mod Rus. One of the greatest teachers I have ever had. If you do the reading, attend class, and study, you will get an A. Blessed to have him as an instructor.

Look- bottom line with this class is just do the reading. Go to lecture every now and then for some context but if you don't do the reading, you're screwed. The final is oral and he will grill you so know useless facts haha. But all in all Peter is the cutest old man that ever lived and VERY intelligent. Med. Russia was an interesting class

I really like Professor Kenez. His lectures are extremely interesting. His TA, Ilya Shrago, is probably the best TA I have ever had. That being said, there is no syllabus and the class is pretty disorganized. Stay on top of your stuff and you will get a lot out of it (you'll also get an A), if you don't do the reading you will do really badly.

Most incredible class I have taken so far and probably will ever take. Baumgarten and Kenez are an all-star team of professors who make the course interesting and funny (ironically). I absolutely adore this class. Not only is it a fascinating topic, but such amazing professors teach it. DEFINITELY TAKE THIS CLASS. Lots of reading, but worth it!

Very good lecturer but his class was not organized, there was no syllabus given out or was the grade determinants known until midterms were announced. Though he lectured well, as others have mentioned I felt he was quite biased... his opinions were set in stone.
he was really very bad. hard to understand and very biased.

I adore Professor Kenez. He is a remarkable human being with a fascinating historical perspective and riveting insights. For those of you who enjoy Peter's teaching as much as I do join the I heart Peter Kenez facebook group.

Professor Kenez is absolutely amazing.  He's somewhat hard to understand at times, but his knowledge is unparalleled, especially in the realm of 20th century history.  And yes, he talks about Russia a lot, but he makes a very solid case for precisely why Russian History is important to understand when reading European History.

As always, Peter's teaching abilities absolutely amazed me. He kept the class interesting for me. The way in which he wove the story of the Holocaust was truly remarkable. The only class I've taken where he received heavy applause at the end of each lecture.

Peter is amazing. Yes, he has a heavy accent, but don't let that get in the way of an amazing educational experience. He lived through the Holocaust, the Hungarian Revolution, and the Cold war as a Jew living in Budapest. Those experiences alone keep me coming back to every class he teaches.

He mumbled and has a thick accent so it was not only hard to hear him, but hard to stay awake. For midterms and finals, you think you will be tested on general things, but you are tested on specific random facts that are unimportant. Get a good t.a., not the one who spent discussions talking about his family in Russia.

he whispers and is not very eloquent in getting his point across. this class was european history in the 20th century and he tended to only talk about russia. i do not recommend this class but maybe his russian stuff is better
He is intelligent and helpfull.  He thinks on his feet and is always very knowledgable of the subject.
Peter is amazing.  He is direct, knowledgeable and warm.  His lectures remind me of stories my grandfather used to tell me, before he passed away.  I highly recommend him. Amazing.
amazing man...crazy old and filled with knowledge.  his stories are awesome and he knows so much about the history of everything.  great voice/thick accent...cool dude.

This was a terrible class. I didn't study for the midterm at all, other than reading Wikipedia and I still managed to get a C...so I suppose it is fairly easy, but spare yourself the torture! Peter knows alot, he just doesn't know how to express it to those not as well versed as he. It is one of those classes where only a few students shine.

Peter Kenez is incredibly knowledgeable. Unfortunately his TA was terrible. I would not recommend Russian History unless you are positive you will enjoy it, otherwise it is boring and you will fall asleep.

His lectures are scattered and you never know what you need to know.  One of those that just talks at you and you're supposed to automatically know what tidbits of info to write down.  Not good for early mornings and his TA was horrible.  His syllabus tells you nothing and you have no idea of how you're doing until you get a grade.
He is one of my least favourite professors at UCSC. His grading system is totally random, and his TAs usually sucks. Don't be late to his class or he will give you the glare of death...

unless you agree with everything in the reading, don't take this class!  he doesn't clearly state how the grading worked and he does NOT grade on any type of system.  your final is the most important.  regardless of your previous work, you can fail the class if he isn't impressed with the final.

hist 135c-soviet russia           definitely a smart man. nice too. but extremely hard to understand! also, theres a book list but no clear syllabus. plus the books are boring, if you take this class, get kenez's book out of the library.... hes nice, but he'll slip into russian, give us maps with russian characters...

So, it was cool having him as a professor because I understand Hungarian.  During my oral exam he actually asked me my questions in Hungarian.  Very sweet and has a good understanding of russia.  For me, the class was overshadowed by the one I had right after (medical anthropology) which was one of the most interesting classes I had.

kenez is one the greatest lecturers, but his reading list and lecture are not planned well. he does not give you defined syllibus, only vauge refferences to what is required. however, he is a very good teacher with great knowledge, ehs written like 10 book

Peter was a wonderful man who is so knowledgeable on  Russian History. For the material that he was dealt, Peter spit out the facts and made going to class a pleasure.He's a very interesting man and definitely a great professor.You won't be sorry for having hiim.

So I was totaly interested in this subject before I took this class, and not I can't stand it. Peter was a good lecturer, but very hard to understand what he was saying a lot of the time. I wouldn't recomend this class even if this was your only choice.

His voice sounds like Dracula! And he makes up the historical lectures in this class whereas Murray does the Literature portion. Very approachable, kind of endearing I recommend this class to GE fillers or anyone whose interested because I came out of this lecture with a lot more than I started with

Kenez is a terrific lecturer.  He is also very friendly and approachable. It's obvious that he knows the material and his ability to relate that material to the class in a clear, logical way is amazingly better than most professors.  I would highly recommend him.
Peter is such a great guy.  I have a lot of respect for him.  His lectures were very interesting and his descriptions of historical events were very complete and understandable.  The guy is awesome.
Great guy! His discriptions of the time before and during the Holocaust are insightful and detailed. Makes class interesting

Totally awesome guy- I talked to him for like an hour about Hungarian Jews cause we're both Hungarian (not Russian despite what people say). His lectures vary between semi-boring and super interesting, but I was really interested in the subject so it was all good.
No Comments
